snippet: The state’s unemployment rate dropped to 5.5 percent in June; the city’s fell to 6.1 percent, higher than the national rate in part because job seekers have been flooding into New York.
abstract: New York State Labor Dept reports New York City unemployment rate fell to 6.1 percent in June, from 6.4 percent in May; says state's unemployment rate dropped to 5.5 percent from 5.7 percent in May; levels are lowest since 2008.
lead_paragraph: The state’s unemployment rate dropped to 5.5 percent in June; the city’s fell to 6.1 percent, higher than the national rate in part because job seekers have been flooding into New York.

headline.main: Unemployment Rates in New York City and State Fall to Seven-Year Lows
headline.print_headline: State and City Unemployment Rates Fall to Seven-Year Lows
